intro: Prockia lobata, commonly known as the broad-leafed prockia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
